name: places/ChIJE1WY94lZwokRnUOIFqWJPzQ
formattedAddress: 120 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 120 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: Regretfully I forgot to take photos but this place is not only clean, it is also aesthetic and well curated. The room is very small (welcome to New York) but the bed is very comfy, with lots of pillows. The towels provided are fluffy and large. The shower had a rainfall head and was super cute with this turquoise blue tiling. I don‚Äôt know if all the rooms are the same but I loved mine. The view overlooked New York buildings and subway stations (it will be loud, they provide earplugs). This is perfectly located but do be aware it is an extremely busy area. You will have to navigate through hordes of people almost regardless of the time of day you leave. However it is next to countless subway stations, and walkable to many areas worth spending time in. The staff here were so kind. I had a rough travel day and they made me feel extremely well taken care of, opening doors and calling for the elevator for me. They were courteous and polite. The price of this place is right. It‚Äôs cheaper than some but not suspiciously so, and the service goes above what you‚Äôve paid for in my opinion.

originalText.text: Location was very convenient and easy to get to places from. The front desk is not staffed 24 hours a day. If you are a needy guest you might not like this place. Easy walk to subway system, little Italy and Chinatown.

text.text: Location was very convenient and easy to get to places from. The front desk is not staffed 24 hours a day. If you are a needy guest you might not like this place. Easy walk to subway system, little Italy and Chinatown.

originalText.text: Excellent value hotel. The interior is really nice (looks new), and the staff are very kind. Honest business, the rooms match the images on Airbnb. There is noise pollution from outside but that‚Äôs the trade off for value and extreme transit availability to the rest of the city. You‚Äôre literally next to a transit stop

There is noise pollution from outside but that‚Äôs the trade off for value and extreme transit availability to the rest of the city. You‚Äôre literally next to a transit stop

originalText.text:
We stepped into the room, left the suitcases went to grab something to eat and search for another hotel. Staying there was out of the question. The room barely fit the queen size bed and the room smelled moldy covered by air freshener.
I have stayed in $80 a day hotels that are way nicer than this one for $300 per night.
Lobby was unattended.
I would stay away even at a fraction of the cost

originalText.text: I love the fact its the heart of Chinatown.I used to hang out down here a lot when I was young. And I already had a wired dream of living in Chinatown and I got to experience that with this hote. An the price is reasonable. And the guy at the desk was super nice and very helpful. I will be planning another visit really soon üòÅ
